news_header: Steve Bannon, a former ally of President Trump, pleaded guilty to defrauding donors for a private border wall scheme. He received a conditional discharge for three years, avoiding jail time. Bannon and others were accused of deceiving donors in the 'We Build the Wall' campaign, which raised $25 million.
news_original_title: Steve Bannon pleads guilty in border wall case and avoids jail time
news_text: Despite claiming he wouldn't profit, he allegedly diverted funds to associates. Bannon's guilty plea prevents him from leading non-profits in New York. He has a controversial history, including a federal pardon from Trump and a contempt of Congress conviction.
